title: Great.  Get it now!
comment: Awesome app. Just 3 suggestions for the developer. UNDO and an AMEND feature to drag one note to another to combine the two. And a way to send every note combined to an email in case you have to upgrade phones.

title: Google user
comment: Best app ever.

I do not look favorably upon applications that hide my data from me. There is stuff that I have typed that I see stored in OI Notepad but I don't know where the heck it put it on my Android. I don't see the data directory for the program anywhere. Yes I realize that once I save the file I know exactly where it is... But in the meantime it shouldn't be hidden from me completely.

title: Love it!
comment: Been using OI Notepad for over 4 years. Simple. Easy to use. Good for taking quick notes or writing long texts. Everything you write can be exported to PC in txt format. Love it! Unfortunately, the developer abandoned this product in 2012. It still works  well, but no updates since. Nevertheless, I use OI Notepad daily, and recommend it completely.

title: Excellent
comment: I love this app!  Some one recommend Ol Notepad to me and it is very useful.  Like many people before me said -it is simple -that is what I like about this app.  I write stories and little things to remember on there.  Other apps I'd recommend is Quickoffice and Keep.  Quick office allows you to make files for Documents, Spreadsheets, or Presentations.  Keep allows you to make a list that you can check off, a quick note, and use Google Speak Now to make a list.  You can also add pictures. Decent app!

title: Really good! But...
comment: This is an awesome app and pretty much exactly what I needed! All except that you should really add an undo/redo button. I tend to make mistakes or paste something in the wrong place, or twice in a row, and it takes awhile to just delete. Also I think on the revert button, there should be a pop up that double checks you want to reset the WHOLE doc. I personally used it thinking it was an undo button since the sign LOOKED like one, and was very distressed to find out it wiped my whole doc and couldnt undo it

title: Fundamental Basic Flaws
comment: You'd expect a note taking app to at least edit text in an error free way; this one doesn't. This gets its knickers badly in a twist with carriage returns, the view of the text gets in a mess (e.g. one line superimposed on another) and you often have to go out of the note then back in again in order to untwist its knickers. Just not acceptable in a note taker, hence uninstalled. Oh and the select/paste functionality is often erratic in its responses. Again, not good enough.

title: What defines a  Title?
comment: It has non-deterministic behavior when displaying the list of note titles.   Sometimes the title consists of the first N lines (for some value of N), with an ellipsis.  Other times, it displays the first N characters of the first line for some value of N such as 3, with an ellipsis.  Sometimes it displays the first line of the note, which is the behavior that I would like it to maintain. but can't control, despite playing with the marquee title option.  I suspect this oddity came about when the marquee option was added. An option to open with the cursor at the top, or bottom, or last position would be nice.  Some notes I want to append new data, others I pre-pend. Other than that, and another issue with OI Date, it's great.

title: 1.3 Update has bug!!
comment: Motorola Atrix 2, Android 2.3.6:   OI Notepad 1.2.3 worked perfectly, but this new title feature has a problem.  I open the app and titles display normally.  Then I open a note and go back and now any title that is longer than my shortest title is considered too long.  Then I open a note and go back again, now my titles are normal.  The cycle repeats alternating between correct and incorrect title views.  This new version doesn't appear to have a clear definition of what "too long" is.  Please fix!

title: Simple and to the point app...
comment: Can import notes from Outlook and integrates with OI Safe, a password tool, to encrypt individual Notepad entries.  If you use both OI Safe and OI Notepad and encrypt notes you can choose which ones to encrypt so things like a note with all your credit card numbers are encrypted with the same password as OI Safe uses.  Install both for some great cooperation!
